title: Low Political Stability
description: In 2023, Mali ranked extremely low in political stability, with a percentile rank of just 2.84, indicating significant challenges in maintaining a peaceful and stable political environment.

title: Limited Women's Autonomy in Health Decisions
description: As of 2018, only 5.3% of women aged 15-49 in Mali made their own informed decisions regarding sexual relations, contraceptive use, and reproductive health care, highlighting a significant gap in women's autonomy.

title: High Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2018, a staggering 68.5% of women in Mali believed a husband is justified in beating his wife when she argues with him, and 62.8% when she refuses sex, reflecting deeply ingrained societal norms.

title: High Prevalence of Anemia Among Pregnant Women
description: In 2019, 59% of pregnant women in Mali suffered from anemia, indicating a critical public health issue that needs urgent attention.

title: Low Proportion of Older Female Population
description: In 2023, only 2.41% of the female population in Mali were aged 50-54, and just 1.38% were aged 60-64, suggesting a relatively young female demographic.
